title-group.article-title: Notched Bar Izod Impact Properties of Zinc Die Castings

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2007 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Notched bar Izod impact testing of zinc die cast Alloy 3, Alloy 5, ZA-8, and AcuZinc 5 was performed at five temperatures between -40 °C and room temperature in accordance with ASTM E23 for impact testing of metallic materials. A direct comparison between ASTM D256 for impact testing of plastics and ASTM E23 was performed using continuously cast zinc specimens of Alloy 5 and ZA-8 at -40 °C and room temperature. There are differences in sample sizes, impact velocity, and striker geometry between the two tests. Bulk zinc tested according to ASTM E23 resulted in higher impact energies at -40 °C and lower impact energies at room temperature then did the same alloys when tested according to ASTM D256.

ref.mixed-citation: Horvick, E.W., Selection and Application of Zinc and Zinc Alloys, ASM Metals Handbook, Vol.2, 9th Edition.
ILZRO (2002), Zinc Alloys Lock Hardware Property Database -ZCA-12, International Lead Zinc Research Organization, Research Triangle Park, NC.
ASTM (2002), ASTM E 23-02, Standard Tests Methods for Notched Bar Impact Testing of Metallic Materials, West Consohocken, PA.
ASTM (2000), ASTM D 256-00, Standard Tests Methods forDetermining the Izod Pendulum Impact Resistance of Plastics, West Consohocken, PA.
ILZRO (1989), Engineering Properties of Zinc Alloys, 3rd ed., p. 14, International Lead Zinc Research Organization, Research Triangle Park, NC.
Schrems, K.K., Doģan, Ö.N., Goodwin, F.E., Fatigue Properties of Die Cast Zinc Alloys for Automotive Lock Applications, AFS Transactions, (2004).
Schweitzer, P.A., Mechanical and Corrosion- Resistant Properties of Plastics and Elastomers, p. 72-73, Marcel Dekker, Inc., New York, NY (2000).
